>So said bernd on 2003-08-01 --------------------

>> am. At what=

>> point does a unit test of an aggregating object, or subclass, 
>> becom=
e an
>> integration test? My head hurts.
>
>My home-grown definition is: Wh=
en the object(s) under test depend
>on slow, complex external resources. e.=
g. databases, filesystems, 
>user interfaces(?), remote objects, ...

An "i=
ntegration test" can be loosely defined as a test whose assertions depend o=
n the expected behavior of a collaborator of the object under test.

A "uni=
t test" can then be defined as a test that is not an integration test.
